intro: Ouratea subscandens, commonly known as the climbing ouratea, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a scrambler or climber, often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The flowers are clustered in umbels and are often visited by various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
